hedline.hl1: 4 Shops Take Part In Two Mergers

abstract.p: Golin/Harris International acquires Springpoint, London-based brand consulting agency; Trombone Associates is being merged into Cox Advertising (S)

block.p: Agencies are being merged and acquired.
Golin/Harris International in Chicago, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, acquired Springpoint in London, a brand consulting agency. Terms were not disclosed.
Agencies are being merged and acquired.
Golin/Harris International in Chicago, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, acquired Springpoint in London, a brand consulting agency. Terms were not disclosed.

Springpoint, which has 42 employees and revenue estimated at $5.3 million from clients like Vodafone, will operate as an autonomous unit of Golin/Harris. Fiona Gilmore, chief executive, and Mark Pearce, creative director, continue in those posts.

And Trombone Associates in New York, an agency with billings estimated at $8 million that specializes in travel and tourism, is being merged into Cox Advertising in New York. The combined agency has 11 employees and billings estimated at $20 million from clients like Finnair and the Caribbean Coalition of Tourism.

Joseph D'Alto, 45, president and director for client services at Trombone, becomes senior vice president at Cox. Odette Fodor-Gernaert, 52, vice president and director for public relations at Trombone, becomes director for public relations.
